result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: STC set for 11-7-2022 reset due to Jury Trial Branch 3. RJG
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:02 PM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Benoy   INCLUDES: 21CF888 & 22CF319   Defendant Gregg Neil Wilcoxson in court.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Gregg Neil Wilcoxson.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial has been set for 11/7/22.  State has filed an amended complaint - adding Count 2.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to Count 2.  Court has received a letter from DE requesting Atty Larimore be removed as his  attorney. Test results have just been received. Court will permit Atty Larimore to withdraw.  PD to reappoint an Atty.  Clerk to contact the PD office.  Court will change11/7/22 hearing to a STC.  Speedy trial demand withdrawn.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

On 22CF319- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Court has already scheduled JT.  Adjourned at 10:56 AM. bph

Arraignment on June 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Final pre-trial on October 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.

11:10 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: Gregg Neil Wilcoxson appeared.  Includes 21CF888 (PTC) & 22CF319 (PH).  Court reviews files.  On 22CF319-  S/T of Tina Sitz of Justice Support Center.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Cross by Atty Larimore. ADA Ellenwood asks the Court to take Judicial notice of bond in 21CF888, Court takes Judicial Notice for purposes of prelim.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court questions attorneys on status of 21CF888, ADA Ellenwood states blood results are not back at this time. Court will set cases for trial.    Cut off for negotiations is 10/11/22.  If no agreement is reached all motions, jury instructions and witness lists are due by 10/21/22.  Bond continues. Court will refer DE to K. Rheingans.  Adjourned at  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:02 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: Gregg Neil Wilcoxson appeared. Includes 21CF888 & 22CF319.  Court reviews files.  On 22CF319, Atty Larimore requesting to set for PH and will waive time limits. Off record DE confirms address and phone number.  Adjourned at 10:06 AM. bph  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Supplemental Report, filed by JSC. SEALED- access to attys.  gll   to js 5/24
By self - 22R 006940. jaf
Per SRN. Fax: SCSO, Dispatch, Jail.  gll
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:31 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood  DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today   DF:  Gregg Neil Wilcoxson appeared from jail. DE updates address and confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. QUASH WARRANT. Court sets STC.  gll  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
